newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU Commission backtracks on enlargement date.
newsitem.headline: EU Commission backtracks on enlargement date.

text.p: The European Commission on Wednesday withdrew an embarrassing statement that no new country was likely to join the European Union before 2002.

Earlier the Commission said in a 30-point fact sheet on enlargement that the length and complexity of forthcoming talks meant that "the earliest realistic date for the first accessions is likely to be no earlier than 2002."
Commission spokesman Thierry Daman told Reuters the document was a mistake and did not reflect the Commission's official position. A new statement would be issued later on Wednesday.

He said the Commission position remained that a firm date could not be set because this depended on such unknown factors as when the EU's inter-governmental review of its treaty ended and how long the membership negotiations took.
On Tuesday evening the EU's External Relations Commissioner Hans van den Broek told a seminar on the separate enlargement plans of EU and NATO that he was not allowed to talk about dates.
The withdrawn document appeared days after French President Jacques Chirac told Hungary he saw no reason why it and other central European neighbours could not join by 2000.
